metadata.title: CVE-2024-36474 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow vulnerability exists in the Compound Document BinaryFile format parser of the GNOME Project G Structured File Library (libgsf)version v1.14.52. A specially crafted file can result in an integeroverflow when processing the directory from the file that allows for anout-of-bounds index to be used when reading and writing to an array. Thiscan lead to arbitrary code execution. An attacker can provide a maliciousfile to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36474` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gsf-1 - 1.14.47-1ubuntu0.1
libgsf-1-114 - 1.14.47-1ubuntu0.1
libgsf-1-common - 1.14.47-1ubuntu0.1
libgsf-bin - 1.14.47-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgsf package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.47-1ubuntu0.1').
